#  ![](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/badges/openchamber-logo-light.svg) OpenChamber
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#-openchamber)
[![GitHub stars](https://camo.githubusercontent.)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/stargazers) [![GitHub forks](https://camo.githubusercontent.)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/network/members) [![GitHub release](https://camo.githubusercontent.)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/releases/latest) [![Created with OpenCode](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/badges/created-with-opencode.svg)](https://opencode.ai) [![Ask Zread](https://camo.githubusercontent.)](https://zread.ai/btriapitsyn/openchamber)
Web and desktop interface for the [OpenCode](https://opencode.ai) AI coding agent. Works alongside the OpenCode TUI.
The OpenCode team is actively working on their own desktop app. I still decided to release this project as a fan-made alternative.
It was entirely built with OpenCode tool - first with the TUI version, then with the first usable version of OpenChamber, which I then used to build the rest.
The whole project was built entirely with AI coding agents under my supervision. It started as a hobby project and proof of concept that AI agents can create genuinely usable software.
[![OpenChamber Chat](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/chat_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/chat_example.png)
More screenshots
[![Tool Output](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/tool_output_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/tool_output_example.png) [![Settings](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/settings_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/settings_example.png) [![Web Version](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/web_version_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/web_version_example.png) [![Diff View](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/diff_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/diff_example.png) [![VS Code Extension](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/packages/vscode/extension.jpg)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/packages/vscode/extension.jpg)
[![PWA Chat](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/pwa_chat_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/pwa_chat_example.png) [![PWA Terminal](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/raw/main/docs/references/pwa_terminal_example.png)](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/docs/references/pwa_terminal_example.png)
## Why use OpenChamber?
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#why-use-openchamber)
  * **Cross-device continuity** : Start in TUI, continue on tablet/phone, return to terminal - same session
  * **Remote access** : Use OpenCode from anywhere via browser
  * **Familiarity** : A visual alternative for developers who prefer GUI workflows


## Features
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#features)
### Core (all apps versions)
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#core-all-apps-versions)
  * Integrated terminal
  * Git operations with identity management and AI commit message generation
  * Smart tool visualization (inline diffs, file trees, results highlighting)
  * Rich permission cards with syntax-highlighted operation previews
  * Per-agent permission modes (ask/allow/full) per session
  * Branchable conversations: start a new session from any assistant response
  * Task tracker UI with live progress and tool summaries
  * Model selection UX: favorites, recents, and configurable tool output density
  * UI scaling controls (font size and spacing)
  * Session auto-cleanup with configurable retention
  * Memory optimizations with LRU eviction


### Web / PWA
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#web--pwa)
  * Mobile-first UI with gestures and optimized terminal controls
  * Self-serve web updates (no CLI required)
  * Update and restart keeps previous server settings (port/password)


### Desktop (macOS)
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#desktop-macos)
  * Native macOS menu bar integration with app actions
  * First-launch directory picker to minimize permission prompts


### VS Code Extension
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#vs-code-extension)
  * Editor-integrated file picker and click-to-open from tool output
  * In-extension Settings access and theme mapping


## Installation
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#installation)
### VS Code Extension
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#vs-code-extension-1)
Install from [VS Code Marketplace](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=fedaykindev.openchamber) / [Open VSX Registry](https://open-vsx.org/extension/FedaykinDev/openchamber) or search "OpenChamber" in Extensions.
### CLI (Web Server)
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#cli-web-server)
```
# Quick install (auto-detects your package manager)
curl -fsSL https://raw.githubusercontent.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/main/scripts/install.sh | bash

# Or install manually
bun add -g @openchamber/web    # or npm, pnpm, yarn
```

```
openchamber                          # Start on port 3000
openchamber --port 8080              # Custom port
openchamber --daemon                 # Background mode
openchamber --ui-password secret     # Password-protect UI
openchamber stop                     # Stop server
openchamber update                   # Update to latest version
```

### Desktop App (macOS)
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#desktop-app-macos)
Download from [Releases](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/releases).
## Prerequisites
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#prerequisites)
  * [OpenCode CLI](https://opencode.ai) installed
  * Node.js 20+ (for web version)


See [CONTRIBUTING.md](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) for guidelines.
## Tech Stack
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#tech-stack)
React 19, TypeScript, Vite 7, Tailwind CSS v4, Zustand, Radix UI, @opencode-ai/sdk, Express, Tauri (desktop)
## Acknowledgments
[](https://github.com/btriapitsyn/openchamber#acknowledgments)
Independent project, not affiliated with OpenCode team.
**Special thanks to:**
  * [OpenCode](https://opencode.ai) - For the excellent API and extensible architecture
  * [Flexoki](https://github.com/kepano/flexoki) - Beautiful color scheme by [Steph Ango](https://stephango.com/flexoki)
  * [Pierre](https://pierrejs-docs.vercel.app/) - Fast, beautiful diff viewer with syntax highlighting
  * [Tauri](https://github.com/tauri-apps/tauri) - Desktop application framework
  * [David Hill](https://x.com/iamdavidhill) - who inspired me to release this without [overthinking](https://x.com/iamdavidhill/status/1993648326450020746?s=20)
  * My wife, who created a beautiful firework animation for the app while testing it for the first time
